title: Bathroom Tile Calculator

seo.title: Bathroom Tile Calculator - Estimate Tile Needs for Floor & Walls
seo.description: Accurately calculate the number of tiles needed for your bathroom floor or walls. Factor in tile size, grout lines, and waste percentage for a precise estimate.

faq.question: How do I measure my bathroom for tiling?
faq.answer: Measure the length and width of the area you plan to tile. For walls, measure the length and height of each wall section. If tiling the floor, just the length and width of the floor area are needed. Ensure you measure in feet for room dimensions and inches for tile/grout dimensions as per the calculator's inputs.

faq.question: Why do I need a waste percentage?
faq.answer: A waste percentage accounts for tiles that need to be cut to fit edges, corners, or around obstacles (like toilets). It also covers potential breakages during installation. A typical waste percentage is 10-15% for square or rectangular rooms, but can be higher for complex layouts or diagonal patterns.

faq.question: Does this calculator account for different tile patterns?
faq.answer: This calculator provides an estimate based on a standard grid pattern. More complex patterns like herringbone or diagonal layouts may require a higher waste percentage than the default. Consider increasing the waste percentage by an additional 5-10% for intricate designs.

faq.question: What if my bathroom has an irregular shape?
faq.answer: For irregular shapes, it's best to break the area down into simpler rectangles. Calculate the tile needs for each rectangular section separately and then add them together. Always round up the total number of tiles to ensure you have enough.
